oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Role of veterinary practitioners in industry-led dairy health and quality programs in Ontario
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Godkin, M. A.
MacNaughton, G.
Barratt, K.
Church, C.
Kelton, D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dairy Farmers of Canada
veterinary practitioner
programs
collaboration
health program
quality improvement
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Ontario dairy industry has recently embarked on a series of health and quality improvement programs for dairy producers as mandated by the national organization, Dairy Farmers of Canada. Uniquely, in Ontario 3 of these programs have been delivered via successful partnerships with private veterinary practitioners. The objective of this research was to illustrate the role private veterinarians can play in industry-led programs, and demonstrate the positive impact of such collaborations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2013; 187
